title: 110_hr2833
content: The Act titled "Preexisting Condition Exclusion Patient Protection Act of 2007" amends regulations related to preexisting condition exclusions under group health plans. The "Preexisting Condition Exclusion Patient Protection Act of 2007" amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act and the Public Health Service Act by reducing the look-back period from 6 months to 30 days and the preexisting condition limitation period from 12 months to 3 months and 18 months to 9 months. The "Preexisting Condition Exclusion Patient Protection Act of 2007" reduces the look-back period from 6 months to 30 days and the preexisting condition limitation period from 12 months to 3 months and 18 months to 9 months. The "Preexisting Condition Exclusion Patient Protection Act of 2007" reduces the preexisting condition limitation period from 12 months to 3 months and 18 months to 9 months for group health plans. The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to group health plans for plan years beginning after the end of the 12th calendar month following the date of the enactment of this Act. The plan termination under collective bargaining agreements must occur within 3 years of the enactment of this Act, excluding any amendments made to conform to new requirements. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS RELATING TO PREEXISTING CONDITION EXCLUSIONS IN HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE IN THE INDIVIDUAL MARKET. Section 2741 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include limitations on preexisting condition exclusions in group health insurance. Health insurance issuers providing individual coverage cannot impose preexisting condition exclusions, except as allowed under certain circumstances. The amendment to Section 2741 of the Public Health Service Act limits preexisting condition exclusions in group health insurance. Individual health insurance coverage cannot impose preexisting condition exclusions, except in specific circumstances. The issuer of individual health insurance coverage may impose a preexisting condition exclusion for up to 3 months. Amendments eliminate COBRA requirements and make a conforming amendment to Section 2744(a)(1) of the Public Health Service Act. The amendments made by this section regarding health insurance coverage in the individual market will be effective after the 12th calendar month following the enactment of this Act.
